section.title: Synopsis
Description
section.p: The fmod and fmodf functions compute the floating-point remainder of x/y (x modulo y).

section.title: Returns
section.p: The fmod function returns the value for the largest integer i such that, if y is nonzero, the result has the same sign as x and magnitude less than the magnitude of y. fmod(x,0) returns NaN, and sets errno to EDOM. You can modify error treatment for these functions using matherr.
